text: In Greek mythology, Astypalaea (; Ancient Greek: Ἀστυπάλαια) was the daughter of Phoenix (son of Agenor) and Perimede, daughter of Oeneus; thus she was the sister of Europa. She was a lover of Poseidon who seduced her, and had two sons by him: Ancaeus, King of Samos, and Eurypylos, King of Kos.Pausanias, Description of Greece, 7. 4. 1Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 2. 7. 1 The island of Astypalaia was believed to have been named after her.Stephanus of Byzantium, s. v. Astypalaia == Calydonian Family Tree == ==References== Category:Princesses in Greek mythology Category:Family of Calyce Category:Aetolian mythology Category:Women of Poseidon
title: Astypalaea
